meanings.definition: The action or process of individuating.
meanings.sent1: Her individuation from the group was gradual but noticeable.
meanings.sent2: The individuation of each snowflake makes them unique.
meanings.sent3: The individuation of the puppies made it hard to tell them apart.
meanings.sent4: The individuation of stars in the night sky is like each having its own story.
meanings.sent5: The individuation of fingerprints helps in identifying individuals.

meanings.sent1: His individuation brought a sense of independence.
meanings.sent2: The individuation of the cells allowed for specialized functions.
meanings.sent3: The individuation of the colors in the painting created a vibrant effect.
meanings.sent4: The individuation of leaves on the tree symbolized diversity in nature.
meanings.sent5: The individuation of voices in the choir added depth to the performance.
